data.title: Switzerland of Central America
data.text: Costa Rica is known as the 'Switzerland of Central America'. It is mostly become it maintains neutrality concerning international disputes but also because the country has abolished its army in 1948.

data.title: Bahía Ballena
data.text: Bahía Ballena, litterally the Whale Bay, is a famous Costa Rican beach known for its shape which looks like a whale's tail. It is also a great spot for whale-watching.

data.title: Ecotourism
data.text: Costa Rica is probably the most-advanced country in ecotourism. Globally, Costa Rica is very environmentally friendly: 99% of its electricity comes from renewable energy, 25% of its land is protected and in 2007 the President Arias declared 'Peace with Nature'.

data.title: Cocos Island
data.text: Cocos Island is an island located 500 km off the Pacific Costa Rican coast. It is known for tales of lost pirate treasures. As such, the place was affected by lots of visit from treasure hunters but the place is protected as a National Park since 1978.

data.title: Stone spheres
data.text: There are over 300 stone spheres in Costa Rica. They are commonly attributed to the extinct Diquís culture but their exact signifiance remains uncertain.
